summary: The 'Patient Access to Innovative New Technologies Act of 2025' aims to improve Medicare beneficiaries' access to new medical technologies. It amends the Social Security Act to allow conditional approval under the Medicare New Technology Add-On Payment (NTAP) Program for breakthrough devices, enabling quicker access for patients. The bill defines 'breakthrough device' and outlines the conditions for conditional approval, emphasizing a budget-neutral implementation and specifying an effective date referencing FDA approvals.
